pr_title: Add Ability to Write a BytesReference to Azure BlobContainer

timeline.message: Add Ability to Write a BytesReference to Azure and GCP BlobContainer

timeline.bodyText: BytesReference.toBytes(bytes) just copies all the bytes in most cases when working from anything that I'm afraid. Maybe we could use com.google.cloud.storage.Storage#createFrom(com.google.cloud.storage.BlobInfo, java.io.InputStream, int, com.google.cloud.storage.Storage.BlobWriteOption...) instead and use the stream we can get out of the BytesReference which won't do any copying?
timeline.author: original-brownbear

replies.bodyText: Sadly Storage#createFrom perform multiples copies 🤦. The alternative, Storage#writer(com.google.cloud.storage.BlobInfo, com.google.cloud.storage.Storage.BlobWriteOption...) performs multiple copies too. I'm not sure if we should apply the optimization for GCP?
replies.author: fcofdez

replies.bodyText: Urgh yea you're right GCP does crazy stuff there either way it seems. I'd say let's just fix Azure then and think about GCP at low priority in a follow up :)
replies.author: original-brownbear

replies.bodyText: I'll revert the changes for GCP 👍
replies.author: fcofdez
